byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone contributed reporting from New York.

abstract: Large construction crane crashes into Grand Mosque in Mecca, Saudi Arabia, killing at least 107 people; accident stirs fears over safety of popular pilgrimage site, which is in midst of multibillion-dollar construction project, as city prepares for millions of visitors during yearly hajj.
lead_paragraph: The toll reached 107 as Saudi authorities were preparing for the annual hajj pilgrimage to Mecca, one of Islam’s holiest cities.

headline.main: Scores Killed in Mecca as Crane Crashes Into Grand Mosque
headline.print_headline: Scores Killed in Mecca as Crane Crashes Into Grand Mosque

snippet: The toll reached 107 as Saudi authorities were preparing for the annual hajj pilgrimage to Mecca, one of Islam’s holiest cities.
